etymology.description: 金(金) (jīn, "metal") derives from the semantic component 士 (shì, "upside-down ritual axe perhaps made of precious materials") and 亼 (rén, representing the phonetic sound).
etymology.interpretation: This character intuitively evokes the idea of ritual items, indicative of precious materials, connecting to the broader concept of metal, which includes valuable substances like gold.

examples.chinese: 金属(金屬)是许多物品的重要成分。
examples.pinyin: jīnshǔ shì xǔduō wùpǐn de zhòngyào chéngfèn。
examples.english: Metal is an important component of many items.
